author: halfninja
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Had 7.2 preview 8 installed manually. Followed the [steps on the blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/preview-updating-powershell-7-2-with-microsoft-update/) to enable Windows Update. Visit the Windows Update settings screen

### Expected behavior

7.2 preview 9 is detected, downloaded and installed.



### Actual behavior


7.2 preview 9 is detected, briefly shows "Downloading 0%", then "Installing 0%, followed by

> There were some problems installing updates, but we’ll try again later. If you keep seeing this and want to search the web or contact support for information, this may help: (0x80070050)



### Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.0-preview.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.0-preview.8
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19044
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### OS Data

```powershell
Version    Caption
-------    -------
10.0.19044 Microsoft Windows 10 Education
```


### Windows update log

[WindowsUpdate.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/7101452/WindowsUpdate.log)



### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: halfninja
comments.body:
Update... the install also fails with winget

```powershell
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> winget install microsoft.powershell.preview
Found PowerShell Preview [Microsoft.PowerShell.Preview]
This application is licensed to you by its owner.
Microsoft is not responsible for, nor does it grant any licences to, third-party packages.
Downloading https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.2.0-preview.9/PowerShell-7.2.0-preview.9-win-x64.msi
██████████████████████████████  97.9 MB / 97.9 MB
Successfully verified installer hash  
Starting package install...
Installer failed with exit code: 1618
Installer log is available at: C:\Users\Nick\AppData\Local\Packages\Microsoft.DesktopAppInstaller_8wekyb3d8bbwe\LocalState\DiagOutputDir\WinGet-Microsoft.PowerShell.Preview.7.2.0.9-2021-09-04-20-30-56.296.log
```

The above log file is empty.

comments.author: halfninja
comments.body: The above might be related to running as admin. Running as user fails slightly differently. Running the .msi by hand complains that it can't find the preview.1 msi to uninstall old versions. Possibly this is what Windows Update didn't like in the background? In any case, I downloaded a copy of that to give it and it's now been upgraded manually.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
1618 is another installation is in progress.

The relevant section from windowsupdate.log is 
```
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3260259 26408 27196 DownloadManager *FAILED* [80070050] ExtractUpdateFiles
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3260385 26408 27196 DownloadManager *FAILED* [80070050] Method failed [CAgentDownloadManager::OpenUpdateInstallDirectory:18169]
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3261144 26408 27196 WIL             *FAILED* [80070050] file = onecore\enduser\windowsupdate\client\engine\agent\wuupdatedeploymentdataimpl.cpp, line = 156
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3261173 26408 27196 WIL             *FAILED* [80070050] file = onecore\enduser\windowsupdate\client\engine\agent\clientcallrecorder.cpp, line = 8482
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3262013 3304  12640 ComApi          *FAILED* [80070050] ISusInternal:: OpenUpdateDeploymentDirectory
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3263218 3304  12640 WIL             *FAILED* [80070050] file = onecore\enduser\windowsupdate\client\comapi\deploymentjobhost.cpp, line = 889
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3263351 3304  12640 WIL             *FAILED* [80070050] file = onecore\enduser\windowsupdate\client\engine\updatedeploymentprovider\lib\updatedeploymentjob.cpp, line = 1820
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3263441 3304  12640 UDP             Deployment job Id 8935463F-3D2E-449B-BC4E-74352D09562D : Update DC4ECB0B-1B16-4559-93A0-47B3480DD1B1.200 failure delegate invoked.
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3263635 3304  12640 UDP             *FAILED* [80070050] Deployment job Id 8935463F-3D2E-449B-BC4E-74352D09562D : Installing for Top level update id DC4ECB0B-1B16-4559-93A0-47B3480DD1B1.200, bundled update id 23D41CF9-2450-44C0-97FA-4A7679CE0055.200 [CUpdateDeploymentJob::DeploySingleUpdateInternal:2817]
2021-09-02 20:56:37.3263656 3304  12640 WIL             *FAILED* [80070050] file = onecore\enduser\windowsupdate\client\engine\updatedeploymentprovider\lib\updatedeploymentjob.cpp, line = 2819
```
`0x80070050` = `ERROR_FILE_EXISTS`. This would be an error in WUA.  It's not giving a lot of details on what the problem is.   I could give you a brute force method to resolve this.  
1. Stop `wuauserv`
2. rename `C:\windows\softwaredistribution`
3. restart `wuauserv`

This should clear the files out of the download sandbox, but you would need to open a windows support case to get more details.

With regards to needing the MSI, this file is normally kept in the MSI cache.  The only time I know that you would need to provide it is if you clean the cache using something like the disk cleanup tool or disk corruption.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Error updating to PowerShell v7.2.0-preview.9 (x64) from preview 8
